      • get

        public int get​(int x,
               int y)
        throws IGrid.BadCellException
        Get the value of the given cell in the grid as a digit from 1-9, or 0 if the cell is empty. BadCellException is thrown if the coordinates are out of range.
        Specified by:
        get in interface IGrid
        Parameters:
        x - column number
        y - row number
        Returns:
        digit from 1-9, or 0 if cell is empty
        Throws:
        IGrid.BadCellException

                int y,
                int val)
         throws IGrid.BadCellException,
                IGrid.BadDigitException
        Set the value of the given cell in the grid. BadCellException is thrown if the coordinates are out of range.
        Specified by:
        set in interface IGrid
        Parameters:
        x - column number
        y - row number
        val - digit from 1-9, or 0 for an empty cell
        Throws:
        IGrid.BadCellException
        IGrid.BadDigitException

      • isValid

        public boolean isValid()
        Return true if the grid is valid. This means that all non-empty cells meet the following conditions: 1) each digit appears only once in each row 2) each digit appears only once in each column 3) each digit appears only once in each 3x3 subgrid Note that empty cells are not counted.
        Specified by:
        isValid in interface IGrid
        Returns:
        true if the grid is valid.

        Outputs the grid as a string.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        Grid as a string.
